intro: Leptophora, commonly known as the rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plants are characterized by their simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. They produce edible fruits that are often consumed by both humans and wildlife. Leptophora species are often found in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing their adaptability to harsh environments.
